security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based markdown skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation, workflow guidance, and example commands for branch finishing and PR creation.

content.user_title: Finish branches for merge and PR creation
content.value_statement: This skill provides a complete workflow for finishing feature branches. It guides you through pre-merge checks, security scans, code review, and automated PR creation.
actual_capabilities: Run pre-merge checks including tests and linting
Perform security scans for leaked secrets
Review changes with git diff commands
Create pull requests using automated tools
Apply PR templates for consistent documentation
limitations: Does not execute commands automatically - user must run them
Requires bpsai-pair CLI tools to be installed
Cannot create PRs without GitHub remote configured

use_cases.title: Complete feature work
use_cases.description: Finish feature branches with proper checks before creating pull requests

use_cases.title: Enforce merge standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all branches meet security and quality standards before integration

use_cases.title: Streamline contributions
use_cases.description: Apply consistent PR templates and checklists across all contributions

prompt_templates.title: Complete current branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Finish this branch. Run all checks, scan for secrets, review changes, and create a PR.

prompt_templates.title: Quick merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Quick finish this branch. Run the quick finish commands and push to remote.

prompt_templates.title: Security check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run security scans on my staged changes. Check for any leaked secrets or credentials.

prompt_templates.title: Create PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request using the PR template. Include summary, changes, and testing notes.

best_practices: Always run security scans before committing sensitive changes
Use PR templates to ensure consistent documentation
Clean up local branches after successful merges
anti_patterns: Skipping pre-merge checks to save time
Creating PRs without testing locally first
Leaving debug statements or TODOs in committed code
Merging without reviewing the diff stat first

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: Requires bpsai-pair CLI tools installed. Git and GitHub integration for PR creation.

faq.question: Can I use this without bpsai-pair?
faq.answer: Yes, the commands shown are standard git patterns. The bpsai-pair commands are optional conveniences.

faq.question: Does this create PRs on all platforms?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on GitHub. Other platforms may need different commands or integrations.

faq.question: Is my code safe when running security scans?
faq.answer: Yes. Secret scans run locally on your machine. No credentials or code are sent to external services.

faq.question: What if tests fail during checks?
faq.answer: The skill will report failures. Fix the issues before proceeding with merge. Tests must pass.

faq.question: How is this different from other PR tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides a complete workflow including pre-merge validation, not just PR creation.
